Ext.chart.series.Pie Example

Tags: Ext JS Ext JS 4.1.0 Ext.chart.series.Pie
[example]
© 2012 Sencha Inc. 
/*global Ext:false */
Ext.onReady(function() {
    var store = Ext.create('Ext.data.JsonStore', {
        fields: ['name', 'data'],
        data: [{
            'name': 'metric one',
            'data': 10
        }, {
            'name': 'metric two',
            'data': 7
        }, {
            'name': 'metric three',
            'data': 5
        }, {
            'name': 'metric four',
            'data': 2
        }, {
            'name': 'metric five',
            'data': 27
        }]
    });

    Ext.create('Ext.chart.Chart', {
        renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
        width: 500,
        height: 350,
        animate: true,
        store: store,
        theme: 'Base:gradients',
        series: [{
            type: 'pie',
            angleField: 'data',
            showInLegend: true,
            tips: {
                trackMouse: true,
                width: 140,
                height: 28,
                renderer: function(storeItem, item) {
                    // calculate and display percentage on hover
                    var total = 0;
                    store.each(function(rec) {
                        total += rec.get('data');
                    });
                    this.setTitle(storeItem.get('name') + ': ' + Math.round(storeItem.get('data') / total * 100) + '%');
                }
            },
            highlight: {
                segment: {
                    margin: 20
                }
            },
            label: {
                field: 'name',
                display: 'rotate',
                contrast: true,
                font: '18px Arial'
            }
        }]
    });
});
